topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Baremetal Region Best Practices

body.p: For security, when working with the baremetal region of the Sacramento deployment, keep in mind the following best practices.

ul.li: Providing bare metal resources to an un-trusted third party is not advised as a malicious user can potentially modify hardware firmware.

Generic cleaning steps presently require the IPA (Agent) based driver AND only wipe the contents from attached disk storage. Advanced cleaning steps such as resetting hardware RAID controllers, or asserting updated firmware requires a customized IPA deployment image with an integrated hardware manager appropriate for the hardware in-use.

Ironic supports use of configuration drives. A user deploying nodes with Ironic directly must do so by creating a whole configuration drive file. In the case of Nova, individual files can be included in the configuration drive upon instance creation. Sensitive information such as Passwords, Keys, or any other form of credential information SHOULD NOT be included in configuration drives.

Configuration Drives should only be trusted upon the initial boot of an instance. Cloud-init utilizes a lock file for this purpose. Custom instance images SHOULD NOT rely upon the integrity of a Configuration Drive beyond the initial boot of a host as an administrative user with-in a deployed instance can potentially modify a configuration drive once written to disk and released for use.
